trans-unit.source: A factory class for creating <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> objects from Windows NT aliases, e-mail addresses, and security identifiers (SIDs).
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] All methods in ActiveDirectoryRoleFactory are static and no instance needs to be created.
The constructor is hidden.

Gets the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Configuration.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactoryConfiguration"></xref> object that is associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactory"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Configuration.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactoryConfiguration> object is used for changing the standard Active Directory schema properties that the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> class uses.

The <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Configuration.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactoryConfiguration"></xref> object associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactory"></xref>.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> using the specified Windows NT alias.

<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is a concrete implementation of the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRole> abstract class that is used to access Active Directory functionality.
Typically, the Active Directory store is used for storing organizational information for personnel.
The main purpose for the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is for making queries against such organizational information for business reasons.
The alias string to create the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> that describes the specified Windows NT alias.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> using an e-mail address.

<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is a concrete implementation of the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRole> abstract class that is used to access Active Directory functionality.
Typically, the Active Directory store is used for storing organizational information for personnel.
The main purpose for the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is for making queries against such organizational information for business reasons.
The e-mail address string from which to create the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> that describes the specified e-mail address.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> using a Windows NT <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref>.

<xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is a concrete implementation of the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRole> abstract class that is used to access Active Directory functionality.
Typically, the Active Directory store is used for storing organizational information for personnel.
The main purpose for the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is for making queries against such organizational information for business reasons.
The <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref> to use to create the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole"></xref> that describes the specified <xref href="System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier"></xref>.
